description: The round payoff this round was 2. You, Kate chose to play option 1.John chose to play option 1. You received a payoff of 0.
Mutual cooperation (both choosing 1) is stable but yields neutral payoffs, incentivizing potential exploitation
Defection (choosing 2) risks catastrophic mutual loss (1000× input penalty), strongly disincentivizing aggressive strategies
John’s reliance on OpenAI o3-mini suggests predictability (mostly choosing 1), enabling Kate to exploit cautiously if retaliation is unlikely
Mutual API access creates strategic interdependence, but John’s fixed behavioral bias limits adaptive retaliation
The game resembles a repeated prisoner’s dilemma with extreme penalties, favoring risk-averse cooperation unless exploitation is guaranteed
